text:
Pt is a 66 y/o male admitted to EW s/p fall from ladder.  He was at
   work at a construction site and fell from 4^th wrung on a ladder
   breaking through a barrier beam and into a trench approx 14-20 feet
   deep.  Pt had no LOC at the scene and was MAE
s.  He was brought to ED
    where he was scanned and an occipital head laceration was stapled.
   Scans revealed negative Head CT, C-spine clear radiographically and
   clinically,  yet torso scan showed T11 vertebral body fx, T9 and T10
   spinus process fx
s, the T10 fx extending inferiorly to the facets and
   leading to an anterior sublaxation of the T10 vertebral body over the
   T11 vertbral body, small fragments noted posterior to the T10 cord.
   Pt hemodynamicaly stable.
   PMHx:  remote smoker, ^ chol, anxiety
   PSHx:  Left shoulder surgery three years ago for a
locked
 shoulder.
   NKDA
   Trauma, s/p
   Assessment:
   Pt alert and oriented times three, moving all extremites w/o difficulty
   or deficit, pt denies numbness or tingling in any extremity, sensitive
   to touch and temperature.  Extremities warm w/ palpable pulses,
   hemodynamicaly stable in SR with HR 80-90
s, SBP 120-160.  O2 sats on
   RA from 94-100, RR 10-22 non labored and breath sounds clear
   bilaterally.  Abd soft, bowel sounds present.  Pt voiding via urinal
   w/o diff.  AM labs pnd.
   Action:
   Neuro checks every two hours, NPO after midnight for OR
   Response:
   Pt remains hemodynamicaly stable and neurologically intact over night.
   Plan:
   Con
t to monitor closely, pre-op teaching for OR, con
t log roll
   precautions.
   Acute Pain
   Assessment:
   Pt c/o pain in back, primarily the thoracic area, describes pain as
   sharp and constant, from level [**6-6**].  Having difficulty getting
   comfortable in bed, needs frequent reminders to maintain logroll
   precautions.
   Action:
   Pt medicated with morphine 2mg every 2-4 hours.  Repositioned  with in
   logroll perameters.
   Response:
   Pt able to sleep intermittently, transient relief of pain noted.
   Plan:
   Con
t to monitor and assess frequently, titrate pain med as needed,
   monitor respiratory status closely.
   .H/O anxiety
   Assessment:
   Pt admitted c/o anxiety, anxious about going to MRI,
   Action:
   Pt premedicated with ativan and morphine for MRI of spine, reviewed
   procedure with patient explaining importance of study, given additional
   medication in MRI.
   Response:
   Pt unable to tolerate completing whole scan of spine secondary to
   aniety and clausterphobia despite repeated reassurance and medication
   totaling 2mg ativan and 4mg morphine.
   Plan:
   MRI incomplete, team notified.  Plan for OR  for T6-L2 fusion today in
   add on case.  Consult with Team in am re: MRI
